text:
Hello everyone,
How do I get access to hubl content variable within my Island? Is it even possible? It shouldn’t be a dnd module and shouldn’t initially exist in a template.
Can you be more specific by what you mean by "Content Variable"
For example do you mean something like `content.campaign` ?
Ok, and you are coding the module into the template like `{% module "my_module" path="..." %}` ? Or you are assuming DnD?

I forked this <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/blob/main/hello-world/hello-world-project/hello-world-app/components/modules/TodoList/index.jsx|https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/blob/main/hello-world/he[…]d-project/hello-world-app/components/modules/TodoList/index.jsx> and now I would like to pass somehow the regular hubl variables
Inside HubSpot I ve just drag and drop this module in my template
I hope it’s a bit clear
<@U06C9826HHQ> do you still see the index page listing modules and partials when you try that URL? or other errors?

Hello all :wave-yeti: Storybook.js question! I have a simple instance of Hello World up and running with <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-js-building-block-examples/reference/cms-dev-server.html#storybook|cms-dev-server> generating the Storybook instance locally. Is it possible to deploy Storybook through HubSpot hosting to share links with PMs/QA/etc? Thanks!
hi tricia, we don’t currently have built-in support for that but it is definitely on our radar as something to think about for the future!

hi y'all - i saw some discussions about utilizing private npm packages in our builds. has there been any progress there? currently working on a project that uses a private npm package to keep styling consistent across projects
